text:
I'm missing httpd.8 and apachectl.8 manpages in the 2.0.44 release... Something
obvious I didn't see?
[andreas@pandora httpd-2.0.44]$ find . -name apachectl*
./docs/manual/programs/apachectl.html.en
./docs/manual/programs/apachectl.xml
./support/apachectl.in
./support/apachectl

[andreas@pandora httpd-2.0.44]$ find . -name httpd*
./.libs/httpd
./httpd
creator: andreas@netbank.com.br
slive@apache.org
text:
The man pages are going away because nobody was updating them.  The programs
are instead documented in the html manual:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/programs/

creator: erik@codefaktor.de
text: *** Bug 17566 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: nd@perlig.de
text: *** Bug 17603 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

There seems to be much interest on the outdated man pages ;-)

FYI: I'm currently working on an xslt solution to re-generate the nroff stuff
from our xml sources. But it will probably not happen before 2.0.45.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
The manpages are generated from our XML sources now and will appear again in the
next release (2.0.46).
creator: nd@perlig.de
